info.author: Utah State University, Brigham Young University, Renaissance Computing Institute (RENCI) at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, Caktus Group, Consortium of Universities for the Advancement of Hydrologic Science, Inc. (CUAHSI), Purdue University, Tufts University, Institute for the Environment at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, University of Texas at Austin, and University of Virginia
info.description: HydroShare is an online, collaborative system being developed for open sharing of hydrologic data and models. The goal of HydroShare is to enable scientists to easily discover and access hydrologic data and models, retrieve them to their desktop or perform analyses in a distributed computing environment that may include grid, cloud or high performance computing. Scientists may also publish outcomes (data, results or models) into HydroShare, using the system as a collaboration platform for sharing data, models and analyses.
info.name: HydroShare
info.summary: HydroShare is an online, collaborative system for open sharing of hydrologic data, analytical tools, and models.
